official-title.#text:
Recognizing the contributions of musician
		  Chuck Brown, the Godfather of Go-Go, to music and to the District of Columbia
		  and expressing support for the designation of a Chuck Brown
		  Day.

sponsor.#tail:
submitted
			 the following resolution; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Oversight and Government
			 Reform

text.#text:
expresses support
			 for the designation of a Chuck Brown Day.

term.#tail:
because he was the chief architect of the musical genre known as
			 go-go, which is a unique mix of funk, soul, and Latin party sounds;

text.#text: Whereas Chuck Brown is known as the

Whereas Chuck Brown was a virtuoso singer, songwriter,
			 guitarist, and band leader;

Whereas Chuck Brown's musical catalogue includes 22 albums
			 released over a four-decade period;

Whereas Chuck Brown earned a Grammy nomination in 2010 for
			 the song

Whereas Chuck Brown was awarded a National Endowment for
			 the Arts National Heritage Fellowship in 2005;

Whereas Chuck Brown's go-go beat has been passed to new
			 generations with undiminished popularity;

Whereas Chuck Brown was born on August 22, 1936, and
			 passed away on May 16, 2012, at the age of 75;

Whereas the District of Columbia has named a street near
			 the Howard Theatre for Chuck Brown;

Whereas Chuck Brown is admired for having risen from
			 humble beginnings and overcoming time in prison to become a model leader,
			 devoted father, and family man; and

Whereas Chuck Brown brought joy to millions of people
			 through his music and never stopped performing until his death: Now, therefore,
			 be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 337 IH: Recognizing the contributions of musician Chuck Brown, the Godfather of Go-Go, to music and to the District of Columbia and expressing support for the designation of a Chuck Brown Day.
